propdef-scroll-margin-block-end.name: scroll-margin-block-end
propdef-scroll-margin-block-end.summary: The scroll-margin-block-end property defines the margin of the scroll snap area at the end of the block dimension that is used for snapping this box to the snapport. The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container’s coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets.
propdef-scroll-margin-block-end.title: scroll-margin-block-end

propdef-scroll-margin-block-start.name: scroll-margin-block-start
propdef-scroll-margin-block-start.summary: The scroll-margin-block-start property defines the margin of the scroll snap area at the start of the block dimension that is used for snapping this box to the snapport. The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container’s coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets.
propdef-scroll-margin-block-start.title: scroll-margin-block-start

propdef-scroll-margin-block.name: scroll-margin-block
propdef-scroll-margin-block.summary: The scroll-margin-block shorthand property sets the scroll margins of an element in the block dimension.
propdef-scroll-margin-block.title: scroll-margin-block

propdef-scroll-margin-bottom.name: scroll-margin-bottom
propdef-scroll-margin-bottom.summary: The scroll-margin-bottom property defines the bottom margin of the scroll snap area that is used for snapping this box to the snapport. The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container’s coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets.

safari.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

propdef-scroll-margin-bottom.title: scroll-margin-bottom

propdef-scroll-margin-inline-end.name: scroll-margin-inline-end
propdef-scroll-margin-inline-end.summary: The scroll-margin-inline-end property defines the margin of the scroll snap area at the end of the inline dimension that is used for snapping this box to the snapport. The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container’s coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets.
propdef-scroll-margin-inline-end.title: scroll-margin-inline-end

propdef-scroll-margin-inline-start.name: scroll-margin-inline-start
propdef-scroll-margin-inline-start.summary: The scroll-margin-inline-start property defines the margin of the scroll snap area at the start of the inline dimension that is used for snapping this box to the snapport. The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container’s coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets.
propdef-scroll-margin-inline-start.title: scroll-margin-inline-start

propdef-scroll-margin-inline.name: scroll-margin-inline
propdef-scroll-margin-inline.summary: The scroll-margin-inline shorthand property sets the scroll margins of an element in the inline dimension.
propdef-scroll-margin-inline.title: scroll-margin-inline

propdef-scroll-margin-left.name: scroll-margin-left
propdef-scroll-margin-left.summary: The scroll-margin-left property defines the left margin of the scroll snap area that is used for snapping this box to the snapport. The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container’s coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets.

safari.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

propdef-scroll-margin-left.title: scroll-margin-left

propdef-scroll-margin-right.name: scroll-margin-right
propdef-scroll-margin-right.summary: The scroll-margin-right property defines the right margin of the scroll snap area that is used for snapping this box to the snapport. The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container’s coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets.

safari.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

propdef-scroll-margin-right.title: scroll-margin-right

propdef-scroll-margin-top.name: scroll-margin-top
propdef-scroll-margin-top.summary: The scroll-margin-top property defines the top margin of the scroll snap area that is used for snapping this box to the snapport. The scroll snap area is determined by taking the transformed border box, finding its rectangular bounding box (axis-aligned in the scroll container’s coordinate space), then adding the specified outsets.

safari.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

propdef-scroll-margin-top.title: scroll-margin-top

propdef-scroll-margin.name: scroll-margin
propdef-scroll-margin.summary: The scroll-margin shorthand property sets all of the scroll margins of an element at once, assigning values much like the margin property does for margins of an element.

safari.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll margin is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 189265.

propdef-scroll-margin.title: scroll-margin

propdef-scroll-padding-block-end.name: scroll-padding-block-end
propdef-scroll-padding-block-end.summary: The scroll-padding-block-end property defines offsets for the end edge in the block dimension of the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region used as the target region for placing things in view of the user. This allows the author to exclude regions of the scrollport that are obscured by other content (such as fixed-positioned toolbars or sidebars) or simply to put more breathing room between a targetted element and the edges of the scrollport.
propdef-scroll-padding-block-end.title: scroll-padding-block-end

propdef-scroll-padding-block-start.name: scroll-padding-block-start
propdef-scroll-padding-block-start.summary: The scroll-padding-block-start property defines offsets for the start edge in the block dimension of the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region used as the target region for placing things in view of the user. This allows the author to exclude regions of the scrollport that are obscured by other content (such as fixed-positioned toolbars or sidebars) or simply to put more breathing room between a targetted element and the edges of the scrollport.
propdef-scroll-padding-block-start.title: scroll-padding-block-start

propdef-scroll-padding-block.name: scroll-padding-block
propdef-scroll-padding-block.summary: The scroll-padding-block shorthand property sets the scroll padding of an element in the block dimension.
propdef-scroll-padding-block.title: scroll-padding-block

propdef-scroll-padding-bottom.name: scroll-padding-bottom
propdef-scroll-padding-bottom.summary: The scroll-padding-bottom property defines offsets for the bottom of the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region used as the target region for placing things in view of the user. This allows the author to exclude regions of the scrollport that are obscured by other content (such as fixed-positioned toolbars or sidebars) or simply to put more breathing room between a targetted element and the edges of the scrollport.

safari.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

propdef-scroll-padding-bottom.title: scroll-padding-bottom

propdef-scroll-padding-inline-end.name: scroll-padding-inline-end
propdef-scroll-padding-inline-end.summary: The scroll-padding-inline-end property defines offsets for the end edge in the inline dimension of the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region used as the target region for placing things in view of the user. This allows the author to exclude regions of the scrollport that are obscured by other content (such as fixed-positioned toolbars or sidebars) or simply to put more breathing room between a targetted element and the edges of the scrollport.
propdef-scroll-padding-inline-end.title: scroll-padding-inline-end

propdef-scroll-padding-inline-start.name: scroll-padding-inline-start
propdef-scroll-padding-inline-start.summary: The scroll-padding-inline-start property defines offsets for the start edge in the inline dimension of the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region used as the target region for placing things in view of the user. This allows the author to exclude regions of the scrollport that are obscured by other content (such as fixed-positioned toolbars or sidebars) or simply to put more breathing room between a targetted element and the edges of the scrollport.
propdef-scroll-padding-inline-start.title: scroll-padding-inline-start

propdef-scroll-padding-inline.name: scroll-padding-inline
propdef-scroll-padding-inline.summary: The scroll-padding-inline shorthand property sets the scroll padding of an element in the inline dimension.
propdef-scroll-padding-inline.title: scroll-padding-inline

propdef-scroll-padding-left.name: scroll-padding-left
propdef-scroll-padding-left.summary: The scroll-padding-left property defines offsets for the left of the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region used as the target region for placing things in view of the user. This allows the author to exclude regions of the scrollport that are obscured by other content (such as fixed-positioned toolbars or sidebars) or simply to put more breathing room between a targetted element and the edges of the scrollport.

safari.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

propdef-scroll-padding-left.title: scroll-padding-left

propdef-scroll-padding-right.name: scroll-padding-right
propdef-scroll-padding-right.summary: The scroll-padding-right property defines offsets for the right of the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region used as the target region for placing things in view of the user. This allows the author to exclude regions of the scrollport that are obscured by other content (such as fixed-positioned toolbars or sidebars) or simply to put more breathing room between a targetted element and the edges of the scrollport.

safari.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

propdef-scroll-padding-right.title: scroll-padding-right

propdef-scroll-padding-top.name: scroll-padding-top
propdef-scroll-padding-top.summary: The scroll-padding-top property defines offsets for the top of the optimal viewing region of the scrollport: the region used as the target region for placing things in view of the user. This allows the author to exclude regions of the scrollport that are obscured by other content (such as fixed-positioned toolbars or sidebars) or simply to put more breathing room between a targetted element and the edges of the scrollport.

safari.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

propdef-scroll-padding-top.title: scroll-padding-top

propdef-scroll-padding.name: scroll-padding
propdef-scroll-padding.summary: The scroll-padding shorthand property sets scroll padding on all sides of an element at once, much like the padding property does for padding on an element.

safari.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

safari_ios.notes: Scroll padding is not applied for scrolls to fragment target or scrollIntoView(), see bug 179379.

propdef-scroll-padding.title: scroll-padding

propdef-scroll-snap-align.name: scroll-snap-align
propdef-scroll-snap-align.summary: The scroll-snap-align property specifies the box’s snap position as an alignment of its snap area (as the alignment subject) within its snap container’s snapport (as the alignment container). The two values specify the snapping alignment in the block axis and inline axis, respectively. If only one value is specified, the second value defaults to the same value.
propdef-scroll-snap-align.title: scroll-snap-align

propdef-scroll-snap-stop.name: scroll-snap-stop
propdef-scroll-snap-stop.summary: The scroll-snap-stop CSS property defines whether the scroll container is allowed to "pass over" possible snap positions.
propdef-scroll-snap-stop.title: scroll-snap-stop

propdef-scroll-snap-type.name: scroll-snap-type
propdef-scroll-snap-type.summary: The scroll-snap-type CSS property sets how strictly snap points are enforced on the scroll container in case there is one.

firefox.notes: An earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

firefox_android.notes: An earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

ie.notes: Internet Explorer supports an earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

safari.notes: Older Safari versions support an earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

safari_ios.notes: Older Safari versions support an earlier draft of CSS Scroll Snap without axis values.

propdef-scroll-snap-type.title: scroll-snap-type
